subhead: Founded in 1616, the city now has 60% of its residents living in informal settlements. As it hosts COP30 in a tightly secured zone, it stands as a symbol of modern Brazil's paradoxes, on the edge of the rainforest.

The private missions of climate expert François Gemenne at COP30
subhead: Gemenne, a high-profile political scientist, has contributed to the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) but has also faced criticism over his advisory roles with major corporations.

title: Trump claims 'very big victory' in Veterans Day speech as shutdown vote nears
subhead: 'We're opening up our country – it should have never been closed,' said Trump during a Veterans Day speech at Arlington National Cemetery in Virginia. The House of Representatives is set to vote on Wednesday on a spending bill to solve the six-week standoff.

title: Is the 'body positivity' era coming to an end?
subhead: After a golden period of inclusivity, the tide now appears to be turning in advertising, on runways and in stores. This retreat is causing concern among activists, both in terms of representing diversity and of the mental health of those affected.

title: Who is behind the romance scams on the rise in France?
subhead: Thousands of French people fall victim every year to these scams, orchestrated from massive centers abroad. The scammers, often acting under duress, use sophisticated technologies, making their arrest almost impossible.

In France's Somme, bagpipers keep the memory of the Great War alive
subhead: On the site of the bloodiest battle of World War I, residents of Ovillers-la-Boisselle uphold the tradition of the bagpipers from Scottish, Irish, Canadian and Australian regiments who lost many of their own here in 1916.

title: In Ukraine, shotguns have become a last resort weapon against FPV drones
subhead: As the extreme lethality of FPV drones devastates the front lines, shotguns are increasingly being used among Ukrainian troops. Military leadership hopes this will save thousands of soldiers' lives and reduce the risks posed to frontline logistics.

title: Hors-Studio: The French duo transforming waste into design
subhead: In Rebecca Fezard and Elodie Michaud's workshop near Tours, these two researchers and sustainability enthusiasts transform leather scraps and oyster shells into biomaterials, which they use to make chairs that look like fossils and tables that seem to emerge from a block of stone.
